overview:
With over 20 years as engineer, product manager, strategist, and business development executive, Dan Greenberg has worked both at and with large technology companies including AT&T, IBM, Honeywell, Westinghouse, and Compaq, and created partnerships with small tech companies including Broadcast International, Matrix Vision, NextIO, and Mental Images. His breadth of experience drives his passion for doing whatever it takes to fill the gaps between Development and Revenue.

Dan has architected internationally deployed standards for fiber-to-the-home and created a framework for understanding the emergence of machine-to-machine (M2M) services. He holds four patents and has had both his technical and management works published. Dan has lived in six States and two countries outside of the USA.

Dan earned a B.S.E in Computer Engineering from the University of Pennsylvania, an M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Caltech, and an MBA in New Product and Venture Creation from the MIT Sloan School of Management.
